meanings.definition: A unit of electric current equal to one thousandth of an ampere.
meanings.sent1: I need a milliamp to power my small device.
meanings.sent2: The flashlight requires a milliamp of electricity to function.
meanings.sent3: Why did the milliamp refuse to flow through the circuit? It was feeling a bit shy.
meanings.sent4: The milliamp trickled through the wires like a tiny stream of energy.
meanings.sent5: The milliamp hummed softly as it traveled along the conductor.

meanings.definition: A measure of the rate of flow of electric charge.
meanings.sent1: The milliamp reading on the meter indicated a low flow of charge.
meanings.sent2: The technician monitored the milliamp to ensure the circuit was functioning properly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous electron played a prank by increasing the milliamp suddenly.
meanings.sent4: The milliamp raced through the wires like a speedy messenger of electricity.
meanings.sent5: The milliamp surged through the circuit, lighting up the room with its power.
